sub_topic: Coordination chemistry of lanthanides and actinides
message_1: What is the coordination number of actinide ion [Pu(NO3)6]2-?
message_2:
The coordination number of an ion refers to the number of ligands (molecules or ions) that are directly bonded to the central metal ion. In the case of the actinide ion [Pu(NO3)6]2-, the central metal ion is plutonium (Pu).

There are six nitrate (NO3-) ligands surrounding the plutonium ion, each forming a bond with it. Therefore, the coordination number of the actinide ion [Pu(NO3)6]2- is 6.
